page.title: 01NASSINGTON.GENERAL REVIEW.
page.content: The area is gently undulating and based on limestones of the Jurassic Oolite series.The River Nene flows toward the sea and is navigable to boats up to the size of a large canal barge.The rocks have been used to build many of the older homes but recent expansion has seen the use of brick and other man- made materials.The population is about 670.Few now work in the block-most commute to local towns.As these towns expand the area is increasingly popular and properties continue to rise in price.This has important social implic- ations.Agriculture is highly intensive and employs few.Large machines partly explain the widespread removal of hedgerows and consequent reduction in wildlife habitats and scenic interest. Efforts are being made to redress the balance.Services are good with shops, pubs and a lower school.
